dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: ...like, it just soared eleven percent after hours, right? Over a hundred billion market cap now. Soared.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ...like, it just soared eleven percent after hours, right? Over a hundred billion market cap now. Soared.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The shares spiked following the results announcement, rising 11% to $644.99 in after-hours Nasdaq trading.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Right. Because we haven't, uh, seen that happen before, have we? With, like, years of volatility and broken promises?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. Because we haven't, uh, seen that happen before, have we? With, like, years of volatility and broken promises?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: After years of wobbly finances, wild stock price swings, unfulfilled promises and Musks self-inflicted wounds from fights with securities regulators and critics, the company may be showing signs of more stable operations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: But this time, it's different! They're actually projecting positive GAAP net income for Q4, and Model Y production started early, too, ahead of schedule.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But this time, it's different! They're actually projecting positive G A A P net income for Q4, and Model Y production started early, too, ahead of schedule.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Silicon Valley-based carmaker reported net income for the quarter of $105 million on revenue of $7.38 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Early production. Uh-huh. Didn't Walmart just sue them because, like, their solar panels caught fire? Real stable.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Early production. Uh-huh. Didn't Walmart just sue them because, like, their solar panels caught fire? Real stable.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Walmart Sues Tesla Walmart is alleging in a lawsuit that Tesla solar panels caused fires on th...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Well, that's, you know, a separate thing. Adam Jonas at Morgan Stanley, he says a new demographic of tech investors sees them as profitable, cash-generative mega-tech now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, that's, you know, a separate thing. Adam Jonas at Morgan Stanley, he says a new demographic of tech investors sees them as profitable, cash-generative mega-tech now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This quarter may be seen as the moment a new genre of tech investors were waiting to perceive Tesla through a new narrative: as a profitable and cash generative tech company with a reasonably-sized market cap in the same discussion as the mega-tech platform names, Morgan Stanley equity analyst Adam Jonas said in a research note.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: A "new demographic." Right. Because, uh, their decade-long track record of not making an annual profit is just, what, suddenly irrelevant?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A new demographic. Right. Because, uh, their decade-long track record of not making an annual profit is just, what, suddenly irrelevant?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A decade after its initial public offering its never posted an annual profit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: But they're projecting over 500,000 vehicle deliveries this year! That's a huge jump from last year's 367,000.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But they're projecting over five hundred thousand vehicle deliveries this year! That's a huge jump from last year's three hundred sixty seven thousand.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla aims to deliver more than 500,000 vehicles this year, up from 367,500 in 2019, including more than 295,000 Model 3s, priced from about $40,000.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Deliveries. Great. What about, um, the Berlin plant? Isn't there, like, massive opposition over cutting down forests and water usage? That'll hit the timeline.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Deliveries. Great. What about, um, the Berlin plant? Isn't there, like, massive opposition over cutting down forests and water usage? That'll hit the timeline.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That remains to be seen, owing to local German opposition to Teslas plans to cut down a portion of existing forest and concerns about how much water the plant will use.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: That's still targeted for early 2022, though, they're working through it. And the Model Y is positioned perfectly in the EV crossover market, according to Edmunds.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's still targeted for early twenty twenty two, though, they're working through it. And the Model Y is positioned perfectly in the E V crossover market, according to Edmunds.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Preparations for its third vehicle assembly plant, to be built near Berlin, are moving ahead and initial deliveries from it are targeted for as early as 2021.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Perfectly. Sure. While CFRA rates them a 'Sell' and points to, like, elevated risks with China and growing EV competition. It's not exactly a slam dunk.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Perfectly. Sure. While C F R A rates them a 'Sell' and points to, like, elevated risks with China and growing E V competition. It's not exactly a slam dunk.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We continue to see significant risks related to the China factory ramp-up, as well as rising EV competition from automakers still eligible for the full federal tax credit in the U.S., Nelson said in a research note.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Still, Musk's wealth is up to $34.5 billion! That's gotta count for something, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, Musk's wealth is up to thirty four point five dollars billion! That's gotta count for something, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Forbes estimates the South African-born entrepreneurs net worth at $32.3 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: For his bank account, maybe. Not for, you know, the company that still posted an $862 million loss last year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For his bank account, maybe. Not for, you know, the company that still posted an eight hundred sixty two dollars million loss last year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Teslas full-year loss was $862 million on record revenue of $26 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: But that was on record revenue! They're consolidating partnerships, like, they're growing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But that was on record revenue! They're consolidating partnerships, like, they're growing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Teslas full-year loss was $862 million on record revenue of $26 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Right, "growing." In losses. And, uh, conveniently vague about the German factory financials, too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, growing. In losses. And, uh, conveniently vague about the German factory financials, too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: TSLA also did not provide detail regarding capex related to its new factory in Germany.
